newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-BRAWL MARS UNITED STATES FIRST TOUR WIN.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-BRAWL MARS UNITED STATES FIRST TOUR WIN.

text.p: Pontypridd's Christian Martin was sent off just 30 minutes into his debut for his part in an ugly brawl as the United States warmed up for Saturday's international against Wales with a 15-13 win.
The Argentine tight head prop was given his marching orders for throwing a punch but it wasn't until late in Tuesday's game that the Americans made their advantage count.

Pontypridd took an eighth minute lead with a try by lock Paul Owen but Mark Williams brought the Eagles back into the game with a penalty and wing Chip Curtis scored a try to send them in 8-5 up at the break.
The Welsh Cup winners regained the initiative in the second half thanks to a Gareth Wyatt try and a penalty from fly-half Jason Strange.
The Eagles had to wait until the 70th minute for the deciding score when replacement Richard Tardits intercepted a Simon Enoch pass and ran more than 40 metres to touch down.
Williams kicked the conversion to give the Eagles a much needed morale booster following their 39-15 mauling by Neath.
U.S.coach Jack Clarke said: "Our opponents came to intimidate us a little today but we weren't going to be intimidated."
